ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Our two main weapons...
ygData.msgSnippet: You ve got to be kidding me :) LOL.  What you ran into is someone who started a bard as their secondary character.   Odds are she was twinked to hell and
ygData.messageBody:
You've got to be kidding me :)

LOL. What you ran into is someone who started a bard as their secondary
character. Odds are she was twinked to hell and doesn't know the first
thing as to how to play a bard. I'd be surprised if she's ever used
anything but selo's, hymn, and anthem ;)

People who play bards badly are the reason that others think we're a weak
class though ;) So no nerfs ;) Let 'em continue to think we're weak I say!

/em cheers on the idiot bards!

hehehe keep the morons so those of us that know our class can enjoy it more
(without nerfs ;)

Lyrnia Jongleur
Bard of Norrath
Saryrn Server
----- Original Message -----
From: "Reece, Tom CPT- 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Wednesday, May 10, 2000 1:17 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Our two main weapons...


> IMO, to successfully use this technique on a consistent basis you need to
be
> going against blues. Yellows and reds may resist too much. Could still
> work but you make take a lot of damage. Against blues I don't lose much
at
> all with this technique. Start off with chain, then fear and then start
> whacking them from behind. I've been using Furfils as the 3d song to
debuff
> their resist rate. Bellow might be a good option for you. Biggest thing
to
> be concerned with is that you don't aggro a second mob while chasing the
> first one.
>
> On a similar note:
>
> Grouped with another 35 bard last night on E'ci in Frontier Mtns. Lots of
> blues in their for us to fight. Told her I intended to use the chain/fear
> technique. She had never heard of the technique before. She told me not
to
> pull any casters. I told her to continuously pixie strike the caster to
> interrupt their casts. With both of us doing it we shouldn't have any
> problems. She said 1) I weave 4 songs ALL the time, never just one and 2)
I
> never fight casters if I can avoid it. I then asked her if she read this
> list or Concert Hall board. Said she didn't have time for message boards
> and hated mailing list spam. I tried my best to tell her about some of
the
> tricks bards could use to defeat mobs. She said BAH I'm a tank. I
laughed
> to myself. Pulled a mob and was killing it easily when another mob joined
> in. She just kept swinging away on first mob so I backed out, charmed the
> second one and had it finish off the first mob. Then noticed she had quit
> the group. Was already low in HPs so decided to zone instead of fighting
> the second mob. Saw her on the other side and tore into her. She said
she
> dropped the group because I backed out of the fight and she was taking all
> the damage. I asked her if she was aware of how our charm song was used.
> She said BAH our charm song was a wasted song and that she never used it.
> On a whim I asked her what her max charisma was. She came back with 89.
> She then started to criticize me for trying to use "bard tricks" to defeat
> mobs instead of pure melee. At that point I decided she was a lost cause
> and I wasn't gonna try to educate her anymore on how to play a bard. It
> just strikes me as odd that at this stage of the game you still find
players
> who have no freaking idea how to play their class.
>
> Galtin
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, May 10, 2000 6:28 AM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: [eqbards] Our two main weapons...
>
>
> Our two main weapons are Selo's, Chains, and Screech... Our three main
> weapons...
>
> But seriously, I expect to get Screech tonite and was hoping to get some
> better understanding of how I might put Screech and Chains to work in the
> wide open expanses of Lake of Ill Omen and The Overthere. Perhaps some of
> the more experienced bards can shed some light on this?
>
> Kitasi
> Nearly 26th and still no last name...
>
